Whether the hospital has a safety committee with a senior person as the chairman of the safety committee.
Is the safety or fire officer part of the safety committee?
Whether documentation of roles and responsibilities and a written constitution of the committee is available.
Whether the safety committee meetings are held as per Terms of Reference (TOR).
Whether fire incident data is available.
Is there a Fire Safety Manual or Safety Manual that addresses fire safety and is approved by top management?
Whether the hospital has a Fire Safety Plan – 24/7 Emergency Preparedness Centre that becomes functional during an emergency.
Fire/Safety Manual includes a plan for fire prevention and control.
Fire/Safety Manual includes systems for fire prevention and control.
Fire/Safety Manual includes maintenance schedules/SOPs for systems related to fire prevention and control.
Fire/Safety Manual includes inspection protocols for fire safety installations.
Fire/Safety Manual includes codes for announcement of fire-related emergencies, procedures, and communication protocols.
Fire/Safety Manual includes responsibilities of different departments in case of fire.
Fire/Safety Manual includes procedures, frequency, and protocols for mock drills.
Fire/Safety Manual includes constitution of Fire Fighting & Evacuation Teams.
Fire/Safety Manual includes the Evacuation Plan.
Centralised HVAC system has appropriate fire dampers to prevent spread of fire, and in case of fire and it  functions properly
Dampers are tested regularly and have a preventive maintenance schedule
Public address system is checked periodically for its proper functioning.
Public address system is available in all the wards and sections of the hospital.
Public address system is provided with uninterrupted power supply.
Public address system is checked periodically for its proper functioning.
A process for communicating emergencies in the hospital is established.
Smoke detectors are installed

Whether the hospital buildings are sub-divided into separate
smoke compartments into which the patient can be moved
without leaving the hospital building or change of floors?
Hospital carries out Electrical Safety Audit at regular intervals as per Indian Electricity Rules.
Electrical installations are periodically checked and tested by competent electrical personnel.
Hospital has installed appropriate ELCB/MCB in electrical installations as per Indian Electricity Rules.
Open wires, damaged wires, loose wires, and overloading are periodically checked.
Periodical checking and measurement of existing earth pit/grid resistance, earth-to-neutral voltage, and measurement of unbalance current in the system are carried out.
Hospital has installed lightning arrestor/lightning masts on buildings as per IS Code of Practice (for high-rise buildings >30m).
Sub-station rooms are free from all sorts of storage materials causing hindrance for accessibility to electrical control gadgets as well as exit in case of emergency.
Preventive maintenance and testing of electrical installations are done at regular pre-decided intervals, recorded, and stickers affixed.
Electrical circuits are free of overloading.
Electrical panels have a rubber mat.
UPS batteries are checked regularly by loading them periodically to check for any heating up.
Proper ventilation is provided in panel, UPS, and equipment rooms to avoid overheating.
Whether Electrical main, distribution panel, lift panel provided with Co2/inert gas flooding system
Whether oil filled substation are 7 mts away from adjoining building
Whether wires, cables used are flame retardant material
Whether Electrical shaft are sealed at every floor with fire stop material
Whether wiring for fire alarm and PA system laid are in metal conduit/Armoured
Hospital has prepared an Evacuation Plan which is updated at regular intervals.
Hospital has assessed the ratio between the number of patients and staff available to assist in evacuation.
Hospital has assessed the reaction time of staff in dealing with emergency evacuation.
Minimum time required to react – is it good enough?
Fire escape routes are available to start evacuation procedures in an orderly manner during a fire emergency.
Final and intermediate doors are easily operable from inside without the use of a key.
Corridors, gangways, and stairways forming part of escape routes are free from obstruction and not used for storage.
Floor and stairway surfaces are in good condition and free from tripping and slipping hazards (including external stairs and paths).
Fire-resisting doors are in good condition, with fully operating self-closing devices, and doors close fully onto rebates.
Doors on escape routes open in the direction of travel.
Escape routes are clearly and properly signed throughout their lengths, with internal doors not forming part of the route clearly labelled.
Escape routes are provided with adequate lighting at all times of the day and night.
Adequate emergency lighting is provided and fully serviceable.
Hospital building has a Fire Escape Chute installed.
Hospital has identified the location of Fire Fighting Equipment in the premises and their appropriate application.
Hospital has conducted fire-fighting drills at regular intervals to enable in-house fire-fighting teams to respond to emergencies systematically and efficiently.
Evacuation drills and mock drills are held on a regular basis.
Date of the last mock drill conducted is recorded.
Reports of mock drills are submitted to the safety committee.
Necessary action is taken to address any issues identified during mock drills.
Whether lighting luminaries provided near Manual call point, fire fighting equipment
Whether detectors are provided inside Electrical shaft, lift machine room
Any sleeping accommodation exceeds 100m2 area have at least 2 door way.
What is the current classification of occupancy as per clause 3.1?
Does the building has multiple occupancies  as per 3.1.11?
Are the general requirements of individual occupancies met as per clause 3.4.
Are structural and non structural elements has sufficent fire resistance ratings as per table 3? Clause 3.4.5
Are doorway or opening in a fire resistant wall on any floor is 5.6 m2 in area with a maximum height/width of 2.75 m for type 1 - 3 construction? Clause 3.4.5.2
Are wall opening protected with fire resistance doors with fire rating not less than 120 min? clause 3.4.5.2

Openings in walls or floors which are necessary to be provided to allow passages of all building services like cables, electrical wirings, telephone cables, plumbing pipes, etc, shall be protected by enclosure in the form of ducts/shafts having a fire resistance not less than 120 min? clause 3.4.5.4
The space between the electrical cables/conduits and the walls/slabs shall be filled in by a fire stop material having fire resistance rating of not less than 120 min? Clause 3.4.5.4
For plumbing shafts in the core of the building, with shaft door opening inside the building, the shafts shall have inspection doors having fire resistance rating not less than 30 min? Clause 3.4.5.4
Are emergency power supplying distribution system for critical requirement for functioning of fire and life safety system and equipment planned for efficient and reliable power? Clause 3.4.6.2

Is there a stand by generator as back up to the critical building systems including fire pumps, pressurization & smoke venting, fire lifts, exit signages lighting, emergency lighting, fire alarm system, PAGA, magnetic door locks, ligthing in fire command center? clause 3.4.6.2 & 3.4.6.4

Is the power supply to the panel/ Distribution boards of these fire and life safety systems safeguarded with fire proof enclosures and location of such systems are in fire safe zone ensuring power supply to these systems? Clause 3.4.6.2
Whether adequate illumination with alternate power supply is provided for safe movement of persons towards and through the exits? Clause 3.4.7
Whether adequate illumination with alternate power supply is provided for locating fire alarm call points and fire fighting equipments? Clause 3.4.7
Whether emergency lighting is independently connected and can be operated by one switch on the ground floor which is easily accessible to Fire Fighters? Clause 3.4.7
Are lighting arrestors provided in accordance with NBC part 4 life & safety clause 3.4.6.5 ligthing protection of buildings?

Are air conditioning and ventillation systems installed such that the danger ofspread of fire, smoke or fumes from one floor to other or from outside to any occupied building or structure is minimized as per clause 3.4.8
Are fire dampers installed which has minimum fire resistance rating of 120 min as per 3.4.8.2.2

Air ducts serving main floor areas, corridors, etc, shall not pass through the exits/exit passageway/ exit enclosure. Exits and lift lobbies, etc, shall not be used as return air passage. As per 3.4.8.3.1

the ducts pass through fire walls or floors, the opening around the ducts shall be sealed with materials having fire resistance rating of the compartment. Such duct shall also be provided with fire dampers at all fire walls and floors with fire resitance rating of not less than 120 min. for clause 3.4.8.3.3
Are fire/ smoke dampers installed to supply air ducts , fresh air and return air ducts  which shall provide proper passive fire protection sealing in case of fire. As per clause 3.4.8.4
Are the surface interior finishing materials used such that it will reduce the flame spread and do not generate toxic smoke/ fumes? Clause 3.4.11

Is there a separate fire command center or designated space to house Fire alarm system, CCTV system,PAGA, building managements system, and constructed with 120 min fire resistance rating walls? Clause 3.4.12
Detailed floor plan along with details of fire fighting equipment and installations maintained in Fire command center? Clause 3.4.12

Whether the floors of the building are provided with exits for every travel distance of 30 meters (TYPE 1 & 2 constructions) as per table 22 under clause 4.4.1, 4.5.1 and 4.5.2,  TYPE 3 & 4 constructions the travel distance is 22.5 Meters. Part 4 of NBC.
Whether the minimum number of two separate exits are provided for each floor as per clause 4.4.1 & 4.4.2.1?

Every exit, exit passageway and exit discharge shall be continuously maintained free of all obstructions or impediments to full use in the case of fire or other
emergency. Clause 4.2.3
Exits shall be so arranged that they may be reached without passing through another occupied unit/passage in others control, if they pose challenge or restriction in means of egress. Clause 4.2.8
Whether all the internal stair cases, lift, lobbies and corridors are adequately ventilated and illuminated as per clause 7.3 of IS 14435:1997?
Doors in exits shall open in the direction of exit. Clause 4.2.9
Whether the height of exit door ways is 02-00 meters and more. Caluse 4.2.11
Are ramps , sloped surfaces, staricases shall be used with handrails. Clause 4.2.12 & 4.4.2.4.3.2
The capacity of the means of egress required from any storey of the building shall not be reduced along the path of egress travel until arrival to the exit discharge. Clause 4.2.13

Suitable means shall be provided so that all access controlled exit doors, turnstiles, boom barriers and other such exits shall automatically operate to open
mode during emergencies like fire, smoke, acts of terrorism, etc, so that people can safely and quickly egress into safe areas outside. clause 4.2.16
Are walking surfaces, ramps slip resistant and in line with clause 4.2.18 & 4.4.2.4.3.5
Are basements having sufficent exits others and in line with requirements of clause 4.2.19
Are numnber of exits determined as per occupant load table 3 and clause 4.3 and 4.4.2.1
Are exit clear of any obstructions, materials are ensures free flow of occupants while evacuation clause 4.4.1
Are exit access is calculated as per 4.4.2.4
Are all exit staircases shall discharge, at the level of exit discharge, to the exit discharge as per clause 4.4.2.4.3
Are Internal stairs shall be constructed of non- combustible materials throughout, and shall have fire resistant rating of minimum 120 min, shall not be built around lift shaft. Clause 4.4.2.4.3.2
Are external staricases, ramps connected to ground and hand rails provided on either end. There shall be no obstructions on the external staircase section. Clause 4.4.2.4.3.4 & 4.4.2.4.3.5
Are staricases and lift lobbies designed and constructed in accordance with pressurization of staricases and lobbies. Clause 4.4.2.5 & Table 6
Are proper compartmentation areas maintained for large spaces to prevent spread of fire. Clause 4.5
Are All exit passageway (from exit to exit discharge) shall be pressurized or naturally ventilated. Clause 4.6
Smoke exhaust system / mechanical ventillation systems where provided, for above areas and occupancies shall have a minimum of 12 air changes  per  hour. Clause 4.6.1 & 4.6.2
Are each basement seperately ventillated. Clause 4.6.2

Are Inlets and extracts terminated at ground level with stall board or pavement lights as before. Stall board and pavement lights should be in positions easily accessible to the fire brigade and clearly marked AIR INLET or SMOKE OUTLET with an indication of area served at or near the opening. Clause 4.6.2

Does the smoke extraction system operate on actuation of flow switch actuation of sprinkler system. In addition, a local and/or remote manual start-stop control/switch shall be provided for operations by the fire fighters. Clause 4.6.2
Is there a gas supply run through manifold and pipes attached to cluster of cylinders and satisfy requirements of Clause 4.7
Are thermal detectors installed in fume hoods and arrangements made for automatic tripping of the exhaust fan in case of fire. Clause 4.7.2
Are manifold installed are away from any air intakes/smoke exhaust openings/ any windows. Clause 4.7.4
Pressure regulating stations shall be designed and installed at critical locations for excess flow shut off valves. Clause 4.7.5
Kitchens working on LPG fuel shall not be permitted in basements. Clause 4.7.9

Rooms containing high pressure boilers, refrigerating machinery, transformers or other service equipment subject to possible explosion shall not be located directly under or adjacent to exits. Clause 4.8
